message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public void Test(Iterator<Value> values) {
    Iterator<Value> tr = values;
    while (tr.hasNext()) {
        v = tr.next();
        x = v.index1;
        if (tr.hasNext()) {
            u = tr.next();
            y = u.index1;
            tr.previous(); // Add this line to move the iterator back to the previous element
        } else {
            u = v;
            y = u.index1;
        }
        System.out.println(x);
        System.out.println(y);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, after getting the value of 'u', you need to move the iterator back to the previous element using 'tr.previous()'. This is because when you call 'tr.next()' again in the next iteration, it will move to the next element and you will get the same value for 'x' and 'y'. By moving the iterator back, you can get the correct consecutive values.
